p: The spike glycoproteins composed of two subunits (S1 and S2) are among the structural components of CoVs. The spikes on the viral surface are produced by S protein homo-trimers, which direct the connection to the host receptors, as depicted in Figure 2. The S2 domain, including a fusion peptide, a transmembrane domain and a cytoplasmic domain â€“ is firmly retained in SARS-CoV-2 [ 27]. It may also be a candidate for antiviral agents (anti-S2). On the other side, only 40% of the SARS-CoV-2 produces an amino acid identity in the spike receptor-binding domain [ 3, 28]. Researchers published a variety of SARS-CoV-2 gene sequences in foreign gene banks such as GenBank. This gene mapping is essential to allow researchers to track the phylogenetic tree of the virus and, particularly, to identify strains that differ by mutation. A spike mutation possibly occurred at the end of November 2019 caused jumping to human beings, according to recent studies. Ciccozzi et al., in particular, contrasted the gene sequence of the SARS-CoV-2 to the genome of Sars-CoV [ 3, 64].
